title: Beta Client Questions.
body:
Sorry, this might be the wrong place to post this.

Looking at the "Activity Monitor" app on Mac, it shows three separate league of legends processes running.  

- Trying to quit the most intensive process, it brings up the "Would you like to exit?" message, then proceeds as usual.  
- Quitting the second process immediately quit the entire application, and now is forcing me to re-patch the most recent update.  
- The third process, the least intensive, when attempted to quit it closed the client and then immediately reopened it.  I didn't have to logg in when it reopened.  

Why does it open three separate processes?  And why are they all required processes?

replies.body:
I'm not on the team that worked on the new client, so I don't have a direct answer for you. If I were to speculate, I'd guess that one of the processes is specifically for the pre-game client, one is for the background patcher and the final process (least intensive) I'm unsure of. 

I hope that clears this up a bit, but feel free to ask any other questions you have.
